Material used.Description: Stable human neuronal cell lines (BE2-M17) over-expressing wild-type or mutant human a-synuclein were used to monitor global alterations in gene expression levels.

Readout description.Result Description: Over-expression of A30P mutant a-synuclein showed altered expression of several gene families, but no specific effect on dopamine synthesis genes compared to wild-type.
Over-expression of A53T mutant a-synuclein showed altered expression of several gene families, but no specific effect on dopamine synthesis genes compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Two clonal lines each for wild-type and A53T a-synuclein were used for microarray analysis.

Basic negative control.Description: Cell line containing pcDNA3 vector alone was used as a reference control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: p-values were calculated using t-tests with experimentally identified probes compared with probes present on the chip belonging to each gene family.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels similar to vector-only control (fold change less than ±2.0).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Average fold change in expression level greater than ±2.0 compared to vector-only control.

Material used.Description: Total RNA was isolated from clonal cell lines over-expressing wild-type, A30P, or A53T a-synuclein for quantitative RT-PCR validation.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression levels of selected genes in A30P mutant cell lines were validated, showing no significant downregulation of dopamine synthesis genes compared to wild-type.
Expression levels of selected genes in A53T mutant cell lines were validated, showing no significant downregulation of dopamine synthesis genes compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple clonal cell lines (2 A30P, 2 A53T, 3 wild-type) were used to minimize variability.

Technical replicates.Description: Four simultaneous reactions were performed and confirmed on at least two separate reaction plates.

Basic negative control.Description: Two clonal cell lines containing the empty vector were used as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Expression levels were normalized to b-actin control, and ratios were calculated using the 2^(meanDDCt) method.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels similar to vector-only control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in expression levels compared to vector-only control (e.g., >2-fold change).

Material used.Description: Cell lysates from clonal lines over-expressing wild-type, A30P, or A53T a-synuclein were used for Western blotting.

Readout description.Result Description: No significant decrease in expression of TH or sepiapterin reductase in A30P mutant cell lines compared to vector control.
No significant decrease in expression of TH or sepiapterin reductase in A53T mutant cell lines compared to vector control.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple clonal cell lines were used for analysis.

Technical replicates.Description: Data is representative of three replicate blots.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-only clonal lines were used as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Semiquantitative analysis was performed by normalizing immunoreactivity to b-actin.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels similar to vector-only control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in protein expression compared to vector-only control.

Material used.Description: Cells over-expressing wild-type or A53T a-synuclein were seeded on poly D-lysine coated glass coverslips for immunostaining.

Readout description.Result Description: Specific results for A30P mutant cell lines were not described in the context of immunostaining.
TH immunoreactivity in A53T mutant cell lines was similar to vector-only controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-only controls were used for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Immunoreactivity levels similar to vector-only control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in immunoreactivity compared to vector-only control.
